acts.title: The First Weekend Without the Child

steps.speaker: Narrator
steps.text: The toys are still on the couch. It’s Friday evening and the silence feels heavier than expected.

choices.label: I’ll clean up and make some dinner — I need to get back into routine.
choices.text: I’ll clean up and make some dinner — I need to get back into routine.

choices.label: I’ll text my friend to go out — I need to distract myself.
choices.text: I’ll text my friend to go out — I need to distract myself.

steps.speaker: Narrator
steps.text: Your friend replies quickly: “We’re at the new bar downtown — come join us!” You hesitate.

choices.label: I’ll go. Maybe a bit of socializing will help.
choices.text: I’ll go. Maybe a bit of socializing will help.

choices.label: No, I think I’ll stay home. This feels forced.
choices.text: No, I think I’ll stay home. This feels forced.

steps.speaker: Narrator
steps.text: Just as you settle in, your phone lights up — a message from your ex: “Did you pack the extra pajamas? She says she can’t find them.”

choices.label: Yes, they’re in the blue bag. Try checking the side pocket.
choices.text: Yes, they’re in the blue bag. Try checking the side pocket.

choices.label: You could’ve checked before texting me.
choices.text: You could’ve checked before texting me.

steps.speaker: Narrator
steps.text: Lying in bed, you scroll through social media. Everyone seems to be in couples or on trips.

choices.label: I’ll log off — this isn’t helping.
choices.text: I’ll log off — this isn’t helping.

choices.label: Maybe I’ll re-download the dating app… just to look.
choices.text: Maybe I’ll re-download the dating app… just to look.

steps.speaker: Narrator
steps.text: You lie awake for a moment, thinking about how strange this new life feels — quieter, but full of possibilities.

choices.label: Continue to Act 2.
choices.text: Continue to Act 2.

choices.label: Pause here (return to menu).
choices.text: Pause here (return to menu).

steps.speaker: Narrator
steps.text: You take a breath and decide to carry this momentum into tomorrow.

choices.label: Continue
choices.text: Continue

steps.speaker: Narrator
steps.text: Saturday morning. Sunlight spills across your phone. The dating app icon is still there — waiting. You hesitate before tapping it.

choices.label: I’ll open it. Just curious who’s out there.
choices.text: I’ll open it. Just curious who’s out there.

choices.label: No, not yet. I don’t want to rush into anything.
choices.text: No, not yet. I don’t want to rush into anything.

steps.speaker: Narrator
steps.text: You scroll through a few profiles — smiles, bios, small talk hooks. It’s both exciting and exhausting.

choices.label: Swipe right on someone interesting — what’s the harm?
choices.text: Swipe right on someone interesting — what’s the harm?

choices.label: Close the app. This doesn’t feel like me right now.
choices.text: Close the app. This doesn’t feel like me right now.

steps.speaker: Narrator
steps.text: Just then, your child’s photo pops up on your lock screen — a reminder from the shared album with your ex.

choices.label: Smile softly — they look happy. That’s what matters.
choices.text: Smile softly — they look happy. That’s what matters.

choices.label: Feel a sting of guilt — maybe this isn’t the time to date.
choices.text: Feel a sting of guilt — maybe this isn’t the time to date.

steps.speaker: Friend
steps.text: “So, any cute matches yet?”

choices.label: Be honest: 'I tried it, but it felt weird.'
choices.text: Be honest: 'I tried it, but it felt weird.'

choices.label: Joke: 'Already planning the wedding.'
choices.text: Joke: 'Already planning the wedding.'

steps.speaker: Narrator
steps.text: As the weekend closes, you realize this was the first time you let yourself think about your own happiness — not just responsibilities.

choices.label: Continue to Act 3.
choices.text: Continue to Act 3.

choices.label: Pause here (return to menu).
choices.text: Pause here (return to menu).

steps.speaker: Narrator
steps.text: A new notification glows on your phone: “Hey, you seem interesting :)” — your first match, or maybe just the universe testing you.

choices.label: Hi! Thanks — I wasn’t sure I’d even try this.
choices.text: Hi! Thanks — I wasn’t sure I’d even try this.

choices.label: Maybe another time.
choices.text: Maybe another time.

choices.label: Careful, I’m still under emotional construction 🚧.
choices.text: Careful, I’m still under emotional construction 🚧.

steps.speaker: Narrator
steps.text: The glow of the screen fades; your reflection stares back. For the first time in months, you ask yourself what you actually want.
steps.tone: introspective · slow pacing · gentle internal monologue

choices.label: I want companionship, not distraction.
choices.text: I want companionship, not distraction.

choices.label: I just miss being wanted.
choices.text: I just miss being wanted.

choices.label: Maybe I’m doing okay — just figuring things out.
choices.text: Maybe I’m doing okay — just figuring things out.

steps.speaker: Child
steps.text: “Daddy/Mommy, can we go to the park tomorrow?”

choices.label: Of course! I missed you.
choices.text: Of course! I missed you.

choices.label: We’ll see, I have things to do.
choices.text: We’ll see, I have things to do.

choices.label: I’d love that — maybe we can bring the kite.
choices.text: I’d love that — maybe we can bring the kite.

steps.speaker: Narrator
steps.text: Later, as the sky turns amber, you realize balance isn’t about forgetting the past — it’s about making space for what’s next.

choices.label: Continue to Act 4.
choices.text: Continue to Act 4.

choices.label: Pause here (return to menu).
choices.text: Pause here (return to menu).

steps.speaker: Narrator
steps.text: Late afternoon. You check the mirror one last time. It’s your first real date since the breakup — excitement and nerves tangle together.

choices.label: Confirm pickup logistics with your ex before you leave.
choices.text: Confirm pickup logistics with your ex before you leave.

choices.label: Skip logistics — it’ll be fine.
choices.text: Skip logistics — it’ll be fine.

choices.label: Cancel the date — you’re not ready.
choices.text: Cancel the date — you’re not ready.

steps.speaker: Narrator
steps.text: Phone in hand. A message field to your ex blinks: pickup tomorrow at 10:00? You can set the tone now.

choices.label: Be clear and kind: 'Pickup at 10:00 at the park entrance, I’ll confirm in the morning.'
choices.text: Be clear and kind: 'Pickup at 10:00 at the park entrance, I’ll confirm in the morning.'

choices.label: Keep it vague: 'I’ll text you tomorrow.'
choices.text: Keep it vague: 'I’ll text you tomorrow.'

choices.label: Sound irritated: 'Just be ready whenever, okay?'
choices.text: Sound irritated: 'Just be ready whenever, okay?'

steps.speaker: Date
steps.text: “How was your weekend?”

choices.label: Be upfront about being a parent and what that means for your time.
choices.text: Be upfront about being a parent and what that means for your time.

choices.label: Keep it light — mention your child briefly, then pivot to hobbies.
choices.text: Keep it light — mention your child briefly, then pivot to hobbies.

choices.label: Overshare about your ex and the breakup details.
choices.text: Overshare about your ex and the breakup details.

steps.speaker: Narrator
steps.text: Later, the date suggests a spontaneous late movie. It would push past your usual wind-down before pickup.

choices.label: Set a clear boundary: 'I’d love to, but I need rest to be present tomorrow.'
choices.text: Set a clear boundary: 'I’d love to, but I need rest to be present tomorrow.'

choices.label: Compromise: 'Let’s grab a short walk instead.'
choices.text: Compromise: 'Let’s grab a short walk instead.'

choices.label: Ignore the boundary and go anyway.
choices.text: Ignore the boundary and go anyway.

steps.speaker: Narrator
steps.text: Home again. Shoes by the door, quiet in the hall. You replay the night — the small risks, the small wins — and notice you’re breathing easier.

choices.label: Continue to Act 5.
choices.text: Continue to Act 5.

choices.label: Pause here (return to menu).
choices.text: Pause here (return to menu).

steps.speaker: Narrator
steps.text: After the date, you take a quiet moment to reflect. How are you feeling about what comes next?

choices.label: I'm feeling optimistic — this could work.
choices.text: I'm feeling optimistic — this could work.

choices.label: Cautiously hopeful, but I need clearer boundaries first.
choices.text: Cautiously hopeful, but I need clearer boundaries first.

steps.speaker: Narrator
steps.text: You consider how (and whether) to tell your co-parent about the date.

choices.label: Share a simple FYI to keep trust intact.
choices.text: Share a simple FYI to keep trust intact.

choices.label: Wait until things feel more defined.
choices.text: Wait until things feel more defined.

steps.speaker: Narrator
steps.text: You think about the child’s routine: what, if anything, needs to change soon?

choices.label: Keep routines stable; no changes yet.
choices.text: Keep routines stable; no changes yet.

choices.label: Introduce tiny changes with advance notice.
choices.text: Introduce tiny changes with advance notice.

steps.speaker: Narrator
steps.text: You sketch a short plan for the next two weeks.

choices.label: Set check-ins with the co-parent and keep dates low-key.
choices.text: Set check-ins with the co-parent and keep dates low-key.

choices.label: Pause dating to reassess personal readiness.
choices.text: Pause dating to reassess personal readiness.

choices.label: Continue dating with explicit boundaries documented.
choices.text: Continue dating with explicit boundaries documented.

steps.speaker: Narrator
steps.text: You close the day with a clearer sense of pace and boundaries.

choices.label: Open main menu
choices.text: Open main menu

choices.label: Re-read reflections
choices.text: Re-read reflections
